content:
Diagnosis:	Prostate adenocarcinoma, T2a N0 M0

Initial PSA 5.6ng/ml, Gleason 3+3=6 on biopsy March 2023. Underwent robotic prostatectomy in May 2023.

[redacted name] attended for routine follow-up today. He has made an excellent recovery from his surgery with good urinary continence and no significant ongoing side effects. His latest PSA is <0.01ng/ml, maintaining his excellent biochemical response. He reports good energy levels and has returned to his usual activities including golf twice weekly. No concerning symptoms reported.

Clinical examination today was unremarkable. His next PSA check is due in 3 months' time and we will see him back in clinic in 6 months with those results. I have explained that his outlook remains very favorable given his excellent post-operative response.

patient_facts.value: Returned to usual activities including golf twice weekly

status_updates.value: Early stage prostate cancer treated with robotic prostatectomy. Excellent post-operative recovery with undetectable PSA
Maintaining excellent biochemical response with PSA <0.01ng/ml
Clinic review in 6 months with PSA results
